channel.title: Comments for Red Panthers
channel.description: Experts in Ruby on Rails Development

item.title: Comment on Crystal tuples: the immutable data structure of crystal by Roger Deloy Pack
item.dc:creator: Roger Deloy Pack

item.title: Comment on Make unit tests great again – Integrate Jasmine into Rails by Lenka
item.dc:creator: Lenka
item.description: Hi Alan! What would you recommend to do if I have my *spec.ts files inside Angular components? How can I ask Jasmine in jasmine.yml to point and run these files as well. And can Jasmine even run Typescript files or do I need some gem/plugin to compile .ts to .js? I'm asking because I'm using wild combination of Rails+Angular6 and I would love to do Unit Tests inside my Component files
item.content:encoded:
Hi Alan! What would you recommend to do if I have my *spec.ts files inside Angular components? How can I ask Jasmine in jasmine.yml to point and run these files as well. And can Jasmine even run Typescript files or do I need some gem/plugin to compile .ts to .js?
I’m asking because I’m using wild combination of Rails+Angular6 and I would love to do Unit Tests inside my Component files

item.title: Comment on Observer Design Pattern in Ruby by Andrade
item.dc:creator: Andrade
item.description: You need to call #changed to actually enable an update call on your notifier through #notify_observers.
item.content:encoded: You need to call #changed to actually enable an update call on your notifier through #notify_observers.

item.title: Comment on Introduction to generating JSON using PostgreSQL by Sleeba Paul
item.dc:creator: Sleeba Paul
item.description: You randomly hit to a tutorial, find `hsps` in a code block, then you look again who is the author and you find it is written by your senior. Nice vibe!
item.content:encoded: You randomly hit to a tutorial, find hsps in a code block, then you look again who is the author and you find it is written by your senior. Nice vibe!
